net.alevel.asteroids.engine.graphics

Class Transformations

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.alevel.asteroids.engine.graphics.Transformations

  • public class Transformations
extends Object
    Utility class. It has functions for the 3 matrices (view/camera, modelView, projection) used to calculate the positions of mesh vertices that OpenGL should draw.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Transformations() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.joml.Matrix4f getModelViewMatrix(GameObject gameObject, org.joml.Matrix4f viewMatrix)
      Uses the view matrix (camera) as well as the scale (size), rotation and position to create the matrix to be used to calculate the position of each vertex in a mesh in relation to the camera
      org.joml.Matrix4f getProjectionMatrix(float fov, float width, float height, float zNear, float zFar)
      Sets the projection matrix and the returns it
      org.joml.Matrix4f getViewMatrix(Camera camera)
      This gets the camera's rotation and position vectors as a matrix that can applied to mesh vertices.
      The camera in a simulation is always at position (0,0,0) and rotation (0,0,0).
      E.g.

    • Method Detail

      • getProjectionMatrix

        public final org.joml.Matrix4f getProjectionMatrix(float fov,
                                                   float width,
                                                   float height,
                                                   float zNear,
                                                   float zFar)
        Sets the projection matrix and the returns it
        Parameters:
        fov - field of view. The biggest angle from the centre that should be displayed on the screen
        width - the window width
        height - the window height
        zNear - closest distance to the camera before the object should no longer be rendered
        zFar - farthest distance to the camera before the object should no longer be rendered
        Returns:
        the projection matrix. Converts view coordinates to 2D screen coordinates

      • getModelViewMatrix

        public org.joml.Matrix4f getModelViewMatrix(GameObject gameObject,
                                            org.joml.Matrix4f viewMatrix)
        Uses the view matrix (camera) as well as the scale (size), rotation and position to create the matrix to be used to calculate the position of each vertex in a mesh in relation to the camera
        Parameters:
        gameObject -
        viewMatrix -
        Returns:
        The model view matrix

      • getViewMatrix

        public org.joml.Matrix4f getViewMatrix(Camera camera)
        This gets the camera's rotation and position vectors as a matrix that can applied to mesh vertices.
        The camera in a simulation is always at position (0,0,0) and rotation (0,0,0).
        E.g. every time you move forwards, to the renderer, the objects are moving backwards
        Returns:
        the view matrix
        See Also:
        getModelViewMatrix(GameObject, Matrix4f)
